page.title: 10DONYATT RAILWAY CUTTING
page.content: The railway in Donyatt closed in 1962 and was turned into a nature reserve in 1981/82. The trains ran from Taunton to Chard. Part of the railway has been turned into a road. In the rest of the cutting the lines have been removed and the place has been left alone for plants to grow. There are some rare plants in the cutting such as the bee orchid and there are common plants like brambles, and nettles. Over sixty species of bird have been seen in the cutting. The main types of trees are oak, ash, apple, hawthorn and hazelnut. There is evidence of rabbits and badgers in the cutting. The cutting is a habitat for many different kinds of creatures.
